article_title: Rhode Island spending over budget for health, social services
article_text: Sign up for our newsletter and have the top headlines from your community delivered right to your inbox

article_metadata.description:
PROVIDENCE, R.I. — Three months into the current budget year a half-dozen state agencies are awash in red ink.
A newly released report on first quarter spending, in the budget year that began on July 1, projects over-budget spending at a potential $54 million.
While that includes the rollover from one year to the next of unspent money from last year, and an uptick in the number of people enrolled in Medicaid, it also reflects an additional $31 million in spending over-and-above the
article_metadata.author: Katherine Gregg
